results.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to "Clarification of Employer's Continuing Obligation to Make and Maintain an Accurate Record of Each Recordable Injury and Illness".

results.latest_major_action: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
results.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to "Clarification of Employer's Continuing Obligation to Make and Maintain an Accurate Record of Each Recordable Injury and Illness".
results.summary_short: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to "Clarification of Employer's Continuing Obligation to Make and Maintain an Accurate Record of Each Recordable Injury and Illness".

actions.description: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 225 - 188 (Roll no. 104). (text: CR H1363)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 191 (Roll no. 103). (consideration: CR H1369)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H1368-1370)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 150, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hastings demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 150.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1363-1368)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 13.
Provides for consideration of H.R. 998 and H.J.Res. 83.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-20, by Mr. Collins (GA).
